item.title: Join CCPD, Sidewalk Warriors for Troy Civic Engagement Opportunity
item.description: The Center for Career and Professional Development (CCPD) is excited to extend an invitation to all students who are passionate about making a positive impact in our community! Beginning at 4:30PM on Thursday, October 3, the CCPD and participating students will volunteer with Sidewalk Warriors in Troy, New York. See Handshake for information on how you can volunteer!

item.title: President’s Fall Town Meeting to be Held October 15
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 3:30 PM - 5:00 PM - President Martin A. Schmidt ’81, Ph.D., invites all members of the campus community to attend the Fall Town Meeting, which will be held in the Curtis R. Priem Experimental Media and Performing Arts Center (EMPAC) theater.

item.title: October is Cybersecurity Awareness Month!
item.description: To help all members of the campus community enhance their cybersecurity knowledge, brush up on best practices and stay informed about the latest campus cybersecurity threats, DotCIO has worked with Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources to curate a number of training resources in Percipio.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Leaders in Action” Conversation to be Held with Brendan P. Keegan ’91
item.description: Date: Monday, October 7, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - During this session, host Prof. Azita Hirsa and Mr. Brendan P. Keegan ’91 — award-winning six-time president and chief executive officer, 19-time board director, two-time best-selling author and the leader behind the bFEARLESS movement — will discuss “Leading & Living through FEARLESS LEADERSHIP – Balancing Work, Life & Self.” Participants will be able to ask relevant questions; refreshments will be served following the session.

item.title: Davies Medal for Engineering Achievement Ceremony to be Held October 7
item.description: Date: Monday, October 7, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM - RSVP to join Rensselaer and the School of Engineering as they present the Davies Medal for Engineering Achievement to distinguished School of Engineering alum Nicholas T. Pinchuk ’68, ’69G, Chairman and CEO of Snap-on Incorporated. The award ceremony will include a presidential conversation between RPI President Schmidt and Mr. Pinchuk, and will be followed by a reception.

item.title: New York Tech Consortium Focused on Defense Work Gets $30 Million
item.description: Rensselaer is among a group of New York state research centers, universities and tech firms known as the Northeast Regional Defense Technology Hub that has been awarded $30 million from the Department of Defense to work on next-generation computer technologies, including quantum computing.

item.title: Webex LTI Legacy Upgraded to Webex LTI 1.3 in Blackboard
item.description: MultiMedia Services wishes to inform the campus community that Webex LTI Legacy (formerly Webex Education Connector) has been upgraded in Blackboard to the new Webex LTI 1.3 connector. This is the final upgrade prior to the start of the semester, and brings in increased stability and features for utilizing Webex within a course in Blackboard. Please refer to the ITSSC Knowledge Base for more information.

item.description: Date: Thursday, October 3, 2024 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - During this seminar, Dr. Pak Kin Wong, Professor of Biomedical Engineering at Pennsylvania State University, will present “Dynamic Single Cell Analysis for Precision Medicine.”

item.title: Women’s Hockey Eclipses Single-Game Attendance Record in Win Over Holy Cross
item.description: On the afternoon of Saturday, September 28, the Rensselaer women’s ice hockey team set an all-time single-game attendance record as 1,552 fans packed the Houston Field House to watch the Engineers defeat Holy Cross 2-0. Andrea Trnkova scored both goals on the day for the Engineers, marking the second time in her career she has logged a multi-goal effort, and Engineers goaltender Reese Keating registered the first shutout of her career behind a 19-save effort.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty/Staff Workshop to Review Supported On-Campus Whiteboarding Tools for Courses, Meetings
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - This in-person workshop will give an overview of two DotCIO-supported whiteboarding tools that are available on campus: working with the whiteboard feature in Webex, and a Box tool called Canvas. Participants will learn more about these two similar tools and consider potentially using them in their classroom or meeting space. Space for the session is limited; please register by October 11.

item.title: Flu, COVID Vaccines Available for Faculty and Staff October 4
item.description: In partnership with Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources, Adirondack Health & Wellness is once again administering this year’s free flu and COVID-19 vaccine clinics. The first opportunity is this Friday, October 4 from 9am-3pm in the lower level of the Heffner Alumni House, so sign up for your flu and/or Moderna COVID-19 vaccines now!
